intro: Psephellus goeksunensis, commonly known as the Goeksu Valley cress, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and basal rosette of leaves. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
